summary: Held at Greensfelder County Park in Wildwood, Missouri, the Ozark Foothills Endurance Runs is a premier trail event offering distances ranging from 25K to 100 miles on technical, single-track terrain. This springtime challenge tests athletes with steep grades and rocky foothills of the Ozark Mountains, all while maintaining a strong community focus through sustainability and inclusivity.
uniqueFeatures: Technical Geological Terrain: The course traverses over 80% single-track trails characterized by 'picky' limestone and dolomite rocks that demand constant technical focus from runners.
Dedicated Night-50K Option: The event offers a unique standalone Night-50K race, allowing participants to experience a mid-distance ultramarathon entirely under headlamps on the rugged Ozark trails.

Strict Zero-Waste Policy: Operating as a cup-free event, the race requires all participants to bring their own reusable 'mess kits' (plate and utensils) for post-race meals to eliminate disposable waste.

media.title: The Rise of Ultra-Endurance Sports
media.summary: An interview and feature on race director Shalini Kovach, discussing her philosophy on trail running and the founding of the Ozark Foothills Endurance Runs.
media.contentSummary: This feature article explores the psychological motivations and personal stories of athletes within the growing ultra-endurance community, highlighting the transition from traditional road racing to extreme distance events like 100-mile trail runs.
